dialogues.text: Oh, I wouldn't tell them anything, Bill.  You'll ruin the good start we had last night.  I felt as if I were being treated like a person.  'Joe' this and 'Joe' that - a nice smile - Quince passed me the rolls -- no 'rapture' or 'passion' or any of those mighty things you seem so intent on imparting, but I am cer- tain, should you - uh - say - uh - who I am - our adventure would end abruptly. Parrish regards Joe, the tie is a sorry mess now, a batwi of silk stretching across his collarbone. JOE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I did so enjoy your family. Parrish is startled, he regards Joe carefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about my family?  This 'adven- ture' involved only me, right? Silence as Joe considers the point, Parrish quickly cross to him, undoes the tie, and now begins tying it for him. PARRISH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell you what, you promised that it's going to be only me and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I won't tell anyone who you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds fair enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a deal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A 'deal'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You give your word, I give mine -- that we'll do what we say.  It's a truth exchanged between two people. A moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got a deal. Parrish seems relieved.  He has now, with some difficulty completed the tying of Joe's tie, adjusts it beautifully Joe's collar, then spins him around in front of a mirror. Joe, catching sight of his own appearance, rises to the balls of his feet, quite taken. JOE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is great! (a moment)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what do we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shake hands. Joe immediately extends his hand toward Parrish, but Parrish freezes on seeing the hand, stares at it, now tak it.  Joe pumps Parrish's hand vigorously, then breaks int broad smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parrish and Joe striding downtown, Joe's jacket fits per- fectly, he blends right in and he clearly enjoys being pa of the smart Fifth Avenue crowd on the way to work.  Parr senses Joe's pleasure, his slight preening, his eyes chec ing out the good-looking women headed for the offices at top of corporate high-rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I got to thinking last night -- with you here, and seem- ingly occupied, how's your work going - uh - elsewhere? A flicker from Joe.  He has heard what Parrish has said, eyes busy with the grift and the sparkle of the Avenue, b he is concentrating on Parrish's words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you were shaving this morning, you weren't just shaving, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were hatching ideas, making plans, arriving at decisions, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you understand the concept then. When you're busy here, your work, what your task is, is being executed elsewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you've grasped the idea.  Con- gratulations.  Now multiply it by infinity and take it to the depth of forever, and you still will have barely a glimpse of what I am talking about. Parrish falls silent, chewing over Joe's admonition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe --?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about giving a guy a break?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make an exception?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's one to every rule.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not this. They stride on, cutting through the crowd, Joe all at hom in his new surrounding, but Parrish just the opposite, un characteristically uncomfortable, phrases forming on his lips but unspoken, then suddenly he blurts out:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I don't deserve this.  I'm still young, this is not my time --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what everybody says.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not everybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what everybody says. Parrish is trying to control himself, glances at Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand. A moment. JOE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you can't. A sudden silence between them.  Parrish's shoulders appea to have stopped slightly, the courage he displayed at rai ing these issues has vanished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's it like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's it like where I'm going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you keep a secret?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So can I. They turn into Parrish's office building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Parrish and Joe enter, Parrish is hailed by JAIME, the Elevator Starter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, Mr. Parrish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, Jaime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knight's Reward in the 4th at Calder -- A bemused Parrish walks on, Joe beside him, Jaime pursuin them. JAIME (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- A closer in today with cheap speed.  The colt will come from the clouds and boom!  Fifty-eight dollar horse.  I get you down, Mr. Parrish, just say the word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, not today, Jaime. Parrish and Joe arrive at the bank of elevators.  Jaime, back at his post, hits a button. PARRISH (cont'd) (to Joe)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, everyday I've walked into this building, Jaime gives me a horse. (a moment)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder if any of them won. The elevator materializes, Parrish and Joe step on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parrish and Joe emerge from the executive elevator, Jenni is waiting as usual with her pad, "Good morning"s, etc. Parrish strides down the hall, Joe right beside him, he p instructions back to Jennifer who, scribbling, hurries al behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- And call my family, I'd like them to come over for dinner tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't the family get together last night --?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (remonstrating, gently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, Mr. Parrish.  Right away. Jennifer wheels and heads right back to the office as Parrish arrives at the door to the Board Room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Joe)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps you would like to wait in my office --?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I'm trying to say is this is a Board meeting and you are not a mem- ber of the Board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure you'll see to it that it won't be a problem. Parrish hesitates, nods, conceding the point, reaches for the doorknob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parrish enters, Joe following right behind him.  A euphon of "Good morning"'s from the various members of the Board including Quince.  Everyone sits when Parrish does but Jo right at home, spots a tray of refreshments: coffee, pas- tries, he heads for them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the Board)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- This is Joe Black, a personal associate of mine - uh - he'll be joining us today.  I know it's -- uh -- unusual, and my apologies -- and Drew -- uh -- carry on. Immediately indications of surprise on Board members' fac Parrish bringing in an 'observer', Drew's reaction guarde but intense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a moment, to Joe)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to see you.  I didn't expect you, but certainly you can't get enough of a good thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the Board)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Board of Parrish Communications - is hereby called to order.  Our sole order of business is an acceptance of John Bontecou's generous offer and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Drew)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have any more of these deli- cious cookies? A hushed silence at the inappropriateness of Joe's inter- ruption. JOE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And a cup of tea.  With milk, I think.  I'd like to try it English- style.  Yes, a cup of tea with milk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything else, Mr. Black?  How about some water?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why yes, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hot or cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And a glass. Drew indicates to the Board's Stenographer to arrange Joe refreshments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly, indicating a chair)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like to sit down, Joe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Joe sits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To review -- we're really crossing the 't's and dotting the 'i's here. Bill had a great and conclusive meeting with John Bontecou yester- day, all that remains for us is to put it to a vote. Smiles and murmurs of a congratulatory receptiveness from the Board at Drew's news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (emptily)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Drew. Parrish takes a moment, draws himself up to say something official then stops himself, what follows is spontaneous, reflective, deeply felt. PARRISH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Umm -- I did enjoy -- or rather I was interested in meeting John yes- terday -- impressive... I suppose... But it did get me to thinking.  I started in this business because this is what I wanted to do.  I knew I wasn't going to write the Great American Novel, but I also knew there was more to life than buying something for a dollar and selling it for two.  I wanted to give the news to the world, and I wanted to give it unvarnished.  The more we all know about each other, the greater the chance we will survive. Sure, I want to make a profit, you can't exist without one but John Bontecou is all profit.  If we give him license to absorb Parrish Communications, and he has his eye on a few others after us, we'll be appointing him to the position he craves -- Gatekeeper.  In order to reach the world you will have to go through John Bontecou.  And not only will you have to pay him to do this, far more expensive, you'll have to agree with him.  Reporting the news is a privilege and a responsibility and it is not exploitable.  Parrish Communications has earned this priv- ilege, John Bontecou wants to buy it.  As your chairman, I urge you to agree this company is not for sale. A silence, everybody shifts, the Board is in shock, Drew trying to maintain his balance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (carefully)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Sounds like you're not leaving much room for discussion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the Board)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.  I know it looks like I'm reversing my field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's your privilege, Bill.  But given our needs, given the absolute necessity for growth, given the fu- ture, the truth is... joining John Bontecou is every bit as certain as - Death and Taxes. Joe interjects:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Death and Taxes'? After a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Death and Taxes"? Another moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What an odd pairing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just a saying, Mr. Black,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of whom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why did you bring it up? Drew regards Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not familiar with the phrase, "In this world, nothing is certain but Death and Taxes"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glad I could be of some help. The Board is provoked and mystified by Joe and even more his presence, they cast meaningful glances at Parrish, Dr coolly grasps the irritation of the members.  Parrish bre the silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shall we adjourn?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the matter's still on the table, Bill -- EDWARD SLOANE, a contemporary of Parrish's, has been wari silent, but extremely observant.  Protective of Parrish, sensing his burgeoning difficulty, he interrupts: SLOANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't we let it rest for the moment?  Give it some air?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well said, Eddie.  Mr. Black, shall we? Joe rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Drew)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those cookies were excellent. He exits with Parrish, the door closes behind them.  A BA of disturbed reactions from the Board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is that guy? Drew grabs a telephone: DREW (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felicia? FELICIA (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get me a Field Background check on Joe Black.  Litigations. Bankrupt- cies.  Credit ratings.  The works. Got it? Drew hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parrish enters, Joe right on his heels.  They booth stop, Parrish regards him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- What's the deal here?  Are you going to be breathing down my neck right 'til the very end?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand. Parrish tries to gather himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I'd like to be alone for a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sad, Bill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I am.  There's a research lib- rary on the fourth floor.  Why don't you go down and read some magazines?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not thinking of going some- where, are you, Bill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe, could I ask you to take a walk? Buy a tie or something.  I know I'll be seeing you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. But Joe doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (prompting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I'd like to be alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  Okay. Parrish reaches into his pocket and hands Joe some cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here -- this will hold you for a while. Joe stares at the money as Parrish shows him the door. PARRISH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know about money, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It can't buy happiness? Parrish opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer, give Mr. Black a map of the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thank you, Bill.  I can manage. Joe goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan is busy giving instructions to a Nurse, a patient o an examining table beside them.  As she finishes, she suddenly notices Joe down the corridor in the reception area.  She is startled for the moment, quickly makes a la notation, hands a chart to the Nurse and heads down the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How nice you look.  Is that your uniform? Susan regards him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you come here? Joe doesn't have an answer. SUSAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you ill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh goodness, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why are you here, Joe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have any time to see you now.  I'm doing grand rounds and then I'm examining back-to-back patients until dinner and then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very well, I'll watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch me do what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's impossible.  I'm a doctor, I'm --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'll be a visitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patients have visitors, not doctors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't mind -- Visible now behind them are a Caribbean woman in her mid- thirties, TEENA, an arm around her mother, EASTER, who is holding her stomach and rocking back and forth in her sea in great pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (urgently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss?  Miss Doctor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a minute, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.  My momma's sicker'n he is. Easter looks up and sees Joe.  She abruptly becomes still eyes wide, as if sudden recognition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Momma. But Easter just stares at Joe, fearful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obeah mon.  I gonna die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Momma, stop it. Is just a man. Joe looks at Easter, curiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Teena)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's obeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad spirit.  She just all fever, she don' mean nothin'.  Please help us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you filled out the insurance forms? Teena shakes her hand anxiously.  Joe leans forward to Easter and speaks softly in perfect, lilting West Indian dialect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No obeah, sister.  No duppy, no jumbie.  Evera ting gon' be irey. Susan and Teena both look at him, astonished.  Easter's fearful gaze remains locked on him. JOE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go wi' de doctor lady.  Momma be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don' leave!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pleading)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Momma. Susan leads Teena away.  Easter is riveted on Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with certainty)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obeah evil.  I not evil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I from dat nex' place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wait here'n to take us?  Like you bus driver to dere?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no.  I on holiday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks around, dubious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some spot you pick. She winces with pain, gasping. EASTER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pain is bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I nuttin' to do wi' dat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make it go 'way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor lady make it irey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not dis pain.  Dis pain tru an' tru. Make it go 'way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't, sistah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (adamant, pleading)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can, mistah.  Take me to dat nex' place. Joe regards Easter, a long moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not time yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make it time. Joe shakes his head, a firm no.  But when he looks and sp to Easter again, it is with concern and even regret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't feel wi' de way tings gotta be, Easter. Susan and Teena return with an Orderly and a wheelchair f Easter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Joe)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come now, Momma. Easter is helped into the wheelchair.  She looks pleading at Joe.  The Orderly starts to wheel her away.  Joe stays putting his hand on Easter's arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close your eyes, Easter. She does, her pained grimace melts into a peaceful smile. JOE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon. He takes his hand away, and the Orderly wheels Easter off

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Teena)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go with her.  I'll be right there. Teena goes.  Joe remains his normal voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's in a great deal of pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Susan regards Joe, puzzled. SUSAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you spent a lot of time in the islands?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some. Joe shifts. JOE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I - uh - I - realize now - uh - my being here - um - your patient -- this is not really appropriate -- and I - uh --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't apologize.  There's nothing to be sorry for -- every hospital should have someone like you. Silence. SUSAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...I'm glad you came.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.  I'm so very glad to be here. Another awkward silence. JOE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess you're busy --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. She doesn't move, they search for words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I could come again some other time. Susan regards him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe, I'm with Drew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sincerely)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not now. Susan smiles gently. JOE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you want me to come again...? A moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go, I'm sorry to say --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be sorry for nothing. Another moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  Well...thank you, Joe. Susan turns to go, hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good-bye, Susan. Susan waves softly to him, heads down the hall, glances b once to see Joe has not moved, is watching her depart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer shows Joe in, Parrish is deep in thought, beside him a meal laid out beautifully on his desk with linen an silver, but untouched. Joe is more abstracted than usual, he is starting at Parrish's food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going to eat your lunch

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all yours. Joe starts eating, Parrish watches him, somewhat fascinat Joe's chewing has improved. PARRISH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excellent.  What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cold lamb sandwich with cilantro.  A little Coleman's mustard. Joe takes another big bite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Truly - uh - splendid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glad you like it.  My wife turned me onto cold lamb sandwiches.  Joan -- that was my wife --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (familiarly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cold lamb sandwiches -- not as chewy as roast beef, not as boring as chicken.  She knew stuff like that. Silence, Parrish getting lost in his memories. PARRISH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Everything reminds me of her -- there isn't a day that goes by that I don't think about her -- One day she was here.  The next day she was gone.  What are you going to do? -- I guess you've heard all this a trillion times before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you stop me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...I don't know. Silence. JOE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How was it the first time you met her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you'd heard a trillion times --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This part I'm interested in. A moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She had on this little blue suit -- with a little white collar that had little red piping on it -- Joe is riveted on Parrish ow, Parrish aware of him, has paused. PARRISH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could have put her under glass and I would have just stood and looked at her.  But when she spoke -- I loved the sound of her voice and her laugh -- (a moment)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I couldn't get enough of her -- and gradually -- or maybe it wasn't gradually -- I realized I couldn't live without her. A KNOCK, the door opens and Drew enters, looks at Parrish then at Joe, stands poised in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I interrupting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to joe)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Just kidding'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down, Drew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before I do -- (glances at Joe)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was hoping we might be alone, Bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe and I have no secrets from each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Joe)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How nice for you both. Drew takes a moment, then plunges in. DREW (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill, pardon my candor, but I was confounded by your decision this morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was hired, you told me, to help bring Parrish Communications into the 21st Century.  This merger is the vehicle -- Joe interrupts:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps a merger is a way to bring Bill's company into the 21st cen- tury.  And perhaps it isn't.  And perhaps cheating on your French Philosophers exam at The Groton School was an expedient way to get your diploma, and perhaps it wasn't. Be that as it may, Drew, a question can often be argued both ways. Drew is stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe, cut it out.  And you too, Drew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Parrish)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought this was practically a done deal --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well now it's undone, okay?  Forget Bontecou!  Scrub him!  I'm tired of his fancy name and his fancy offer. I'm not going for it. A moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Drew heads for the door, turns around. DREW (cont'd) (to Parrish)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I invite myself to dinner tonight? (a moment)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan and I had ticket for the Knicks game.  But she said you guys were getting together --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dinner?  Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Joe)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn decent of you. Drew exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, at this juncture, are you letting yourself be so concerned by business matters?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want anybody buying up my life's work and turning it into something it wasn't meant to be.  A man wants to leave something behind. And he wants it left behind the way he made it.  And he wants it to be run the way he run it -- with a sense of honor, of dedication, of truth. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I don't need your goddamn permis- sion either!  You!  Drew!  I don't need anyone to tell me how to run my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy, Bill.  You'll give yourself a heart attack and ruin my vacation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The skyline glitters through the terrace windows.  The ho is before dinner, Coyle and Luisa weave seamlessly among family, offering hors d'oeuvres and drinks on a tray. Allison and Susan together by a piano; Parrish, Quince an distracted Joe are gathered near the terrace.  Joe's eyes are on Susan across the room.  Her eyes flicker towards h aware of his gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Susan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...We're never all together two nights in a row.  Maybe Christmas, Thanksgiving, that's it.  What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing's going on.  Maybe he doesn't want to be alone.  He's go- ing to be sixty-five in a minute --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I don't know, Daddy seems funny to me.  Ever since Joe showed.  It's like he dropped from the clouds... Drew enters.  He nuzzles Susan's neck, out of the corner her eye she sees Joe still observing them. ALLISON (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...When Daddy walked in with him, he couldn't even remember his name.  Now he's his house guest.  And you know how he hates house guests.  What is going on? Drew, whose eyes have also been on Joe across the room, t back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Susan and Allison)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good question. Allison sees Susan's eyes flicker over towards Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- But he does seem very nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over at the terrace, Quince buttonholes Parrish, Joe stan ing by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Parrish)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I read you all the way on the Bontecou thing, and I know where you're coming from.  And I'm with you a hundred and one percent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Quince.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I've got to tell you, if mergers are in the wild, I've got some great prospects I've developed.  I want to talk to you about them next week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next week?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Or the week after. Quince sees Parrish hesitate. QUINCE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, anything is possible. (lightly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's up to Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe, you don't know how glad I am you're aboard.  Anybody who can take some of the weight off the old man, I'm in his corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's very gracious of you, Quince.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem.  I'll leave you two alone.  I can tell you guys have something on the fire -- An excited Quince drains his drink and heads for Drew as Allison appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Parrish)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you know twenty-six members of your rifle company are coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the Korean War.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conflict, honey.  Korean Conflict.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever it was, they'll be here. We sent out invitations to everyone, plane tickets included -- the RSVP's are amazing.  A few of them we didn't hear from, and some of them are dead, of course --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a moment)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, we're going to give this party for you whether you like it or not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like it.  I like it.  I'm sorry I don't seem more appreciative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (resignedly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay, Daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across the room, Quince has pulled Drew aside:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I know you're down, but you know when you're down, Drew, there's no place to go but up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Quince.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind Bontecou.  I've got some other merger possibilities up my sleeve, and I'm putting them to see old man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll do it together.  I'll clue you in.  Timing's got to be right.  The old man says it's up to Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'It's up to Joe'?  Those were his words?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'It's up to Joe', huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's what he said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's very interesting. Drew gazes intently over at Joe who is crossing to Susan, for the moment by herself near the piano.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought so, too.  Joe's a neat guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Neat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe approaches Susan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to apologize, Susan --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you said 'Be sorry for nothing'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, now I am sorry.  For intruding on you this afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't an intrusion.  And if it was, it turned out to be welcome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I appreciate you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean I appreciate that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I appreciate you, too. A moment between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (delighted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do?  Well, thank you very much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drew crosses over to Parrish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was a little abrupt with you this afternoon, Drew.  Forgive me.  I want you to know I value your advice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As much as Joe's? Parrish doesn't answer. DREW (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is this man?  He's giving ubiquitous a bad name. A moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're competitive soul, Drew. That's what makes you a great addi- tion to the money.  Joe is just... around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For how long?  And why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.  Don't worry about him.  And above all, don't antagonize him. Drew glances over at Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boss's orders, huh?  I'm great at following them.  And I think I'll start right now. Allison calls out from the other side of the room:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dinner's ready, everybody! A BUZZ as Coyle opens the doors to the dining room and th family files in, Drew lingering behind with Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a confession to make to you, Joe. Joe just smiles in response. DREW (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to hear it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pleasantly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm going to tell you anyway. I did cheat on that exam at Groton. But so did twenty-six other guys, and nobody ever mentioned it until today.  And I'm expecting you won't mention it again.  I don't know who you are and where you're getting your information, but I'm willing to pretend I did not hear it, and let bygones be bygones.  But can I tell you something else, it'd be nice to see the big guy without you next to him.  What are you, his shadow?  Do you hold his dick for him when he goes to take a leak?  You know some- times somebody would like a few min- utes alone with W.P.  That means without you.  Okay, pal?  Let's eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone eating silently but looks are exchanged, glances averted, Allison notices Susan and Joe looking at each other, Drew observes Parrish watching Joe, Quince, on the other hand, just eats. Breaking the silence, Parrish chinks his glass, stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I - uh - want to thank you all for coming - uh - my family -- Everyone at the table is all attention. PARRISH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Allison and Quince, Susan -- and the other members -- He glances at Joe, stops. PARRISH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I'm so happy when we can get together -- I mean I know you all have busy lives --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look who's talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a laugh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, speak for yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway -- I remember when you were little girls -- An awkward pause.  Quince chooses to fill the silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love little girls -- Allison elbows him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now you're all grown up -- and I'm - uh - um -- Parrish struggles to keep his emotions in check, Drew clocking his behavior very carefully. PARRISH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had some words all prepared but now I've forgotten them - uh - um - wait a minute. Silence, everyone waiting for Parrish to proceed. PARRISH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, it's gone...um -- it was on the tip of my tongue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll come back, Daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will it?... Parrish looking around, searching for words he will not f PARRISH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, I'd like to go on but... He hesitates, drifts into silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tentatively)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy, you could sit down if you wanted to. A moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is so much I would like to say -- but I can't -- (another moment)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I better sit down.  Carry on, everybody. He sits, then immediately stands up again. PARRISH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One other thing -- why don't we all have dinner again tomorrow night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dinner?  Again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haven't you had enough of us, Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with great sincerity)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. The word lands with effect, Susan and Allison have heard well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With bells on. The guests try to return to their food, Susan is the most concerned about Parrish's lapse, she does not say anythin but Drew next to her senses her empathy and, in something a display, gives her a pro forma hug.  Joe has observed every instant of Drew's performance, his anxiety is palpa when Coyle leans over to serve him, offering a tray of a roast that has been carved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Coyle)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would prefer some peanut butter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How would you like that, sir?  On some kind of toast?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toast?  No...just the butter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right away. Coyle heads for the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you love peanut butter so much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intimately)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I adore things like that....food I can't do without.  Don't you? Joe is locked on Susan, it is as if there is nobody else room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It comforts you, doesn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (captivated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes...I've found that it does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mind if I throw up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (admonishing gently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Drew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Susan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm very concerned about the woman you attended to today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has her pain abated?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're doing what we can for her. But it doesn't look good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry to hear that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are we talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Susan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I know she's grateful for the care you're giving her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this a state secret or are we being excluded just for the fun of it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Drew)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan's patient is whom we are talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe visited the hospital today. Parrish's head swivels to Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he?  That's more than we get to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, maybe next time Joe goes, he'll take us along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps you could remind me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll make a note of it.  Anything else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to come, too.  See Susan strut her stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're on, Quin-cee.  Destination Hospital.  Joe, you'll be the Tour Guide.  Okay?  How's that sound to you? Silence.  Parrish regards Joe, then Susan, his face refle a sudden concern with their relationship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan is a wonderful doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After dinner, the family and guests file back in from the dining room, Drew alongside Parrish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go, Bill -- it's been a helluva day.  Need a few minutes to sort everything out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, we'll see you tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Drew peels off, heads for the foyer and front door, Susan follows him. Parrish corners Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you go to the hospital?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were just curious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About Susan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't put it that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What way would you put it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tell me, Bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about you telling me?  When I ask a simple question, I expect a straight answer.  That's what I'm used to.  Anybody who doesn't give it to me, I fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going to fire me, Bill? Silence, Parrish is at a loss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drew is putting on his coat, Susan with him, a tension be them, a heavy silence finally broken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...See you tomorrow night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Include me out.  I've had enough of the conversations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't mean that.  You wouldn't disappoint Daddy --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy'll do fine.  Besides, he's got Joe. (a moment)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And so do you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drew, you're out of line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That may be.  But I don't like the fucker.  I don't like the way he looks at you and talks to you.  And vice versa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, but I like the way he looks and talks to me.  And vice versa. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not okay.  I thought we had a good thing going here. (a moment)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It shows you never know. Silence, neither knows how to continue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... goodnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Goodnight. Drew goes, Susan turns to find out at the far end of the he's been observing them.  She walks up to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long have you been standing there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like the way Drew spoken to you.  But I feel better about it now because of the way you spoke back. A moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me about yourself, Joe.  Who you are.  What you're doing with my father. Susan's directness has caught him by surprise, Joe blinks SUSAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're not going to tell me? Joe remains silent, rendered extremely anxious by Susan's inquiries. SUSAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're married, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because guys who never say anything about themselves are always married. Joe doesn't respond. SUSAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you are married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Girlfriend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Susan comes closer to Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then tell me, Joe, how come a man as attractive, intelligent, well- spoken ,diffident in the most sed- uctive way, and yet powerful, is all alone in this world? Joe tries to respond but he can't, his stammer interrupte by Susan. SUSAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I don't want to pry and you don't want to tell me.  So let's leave it a mystery.  That's the way you want it, isn't it? Susan takes another step closer to Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, I appreciate that. They are inches apart now, the smell of each other surrou them, a heaviness to the moment, now Joe turns to head up stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly fragile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'To bed'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  I'm tired. He excuses himself with an ineffable gesture, now climbs stairs, Susan watches him disappear. She turns back into the salon just as Allison and Quince exiting, "good-byes" all around.  Susan is left alone now with Parrish who is fixing a drink at a sidebar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was wonderful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's good to get together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you mind if I raise a little caution flag?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raise away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is the nature of your interest in Joe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, remember how you told me about "lightning striking"?  The nature of it's in there somewhere. Parrish drops another cube of ice in his drink, takes his time before answering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't say you may be getting onto shaken ground --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what will you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think this is the lightning you are looking for.  Drew's a good man.  I know I didn't seem to be completely in his corner before, but I've come to appreciate --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we love Drew and Joe in verbo- ten?  What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you say 'nothing' that way, it's not nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's something. She kisses him. SUSAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: G'night, Daddy.  See you tomorrow. This is getting interesting. She goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large suite, room service carts creaking with pots of coffee and half-eaten pastries.  The Board of Parrish Communications is gathered, absent are Parrish and Quince Felicia, Drew's secretary, takes notes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I know you're all as uncomfor- table as I am to be meeting without Bill, but I got a call last night from John Bontecou.  Not only is he still interested, he is sweetening his offer. (a moment)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Although it pains me to say it, in my opinion Bill Parrish dealt with us peremptorily in dismissing any deal with Bontecou.  Therefore, I'm sorry to say that if we are to exam- ine this new offer responsibly as the Board of Directors of Parrish Communications, we must do so with- out its Chairman. (another moment)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes, there is one additional element: Bontecou is so anxious to get us, he said he'd take Parrish Communications with our Chairman or without. The Board falls silent.  Sloane, a peer of Parrish's, fidgets.  Drew milks the moment. DREW (cont'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's no surprise if I suggest to you that the Bill Parrish we know is not the Bill Parrish you saw yesterday. You heard that speech -- some strange emotional rationale to buttress a knee-jerk rejection of a legitimate offer.  Does it not strike you that something is possibly affecting this man's judgement?  More specifically -- his judgement to make a critical business decision? Silence, the Board clocking Drew's argument. DREW (cont'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not pleasant to say the follow- ing, but I would be remiss, in this crisis, if I did not.  When we pre- sent Bill with the improved Bontecou offer, and if he refuses to let us consider it -- once more makes an adamant or emotional rejection -- we will have no choice but to seek an alternative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what would that be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill's birthday is the day after tomorrow.  There is a provisory by- law in our charter.  Per the discre- tion of the Board, Corporate off- icers can be retired at age sixty- five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're taking this too far, Drew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I not obligated to? Drew leans over to Felicia, speaks quietly and she leaves the room. DREW (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did this all come about?  Crisis -- Bill Parrish, crisis -- his com- pany, crisis for us.  I came about with the arrival on the scene of -- Mr. Joe Black.  Mr. Joe who?  Joe Black.  He attends our Board meet- int, he sleeps at Bill's house, re- sides in his office.  Never leaves his side.  And, in my opinion, is always in his ear.  Telling him what to do and Bill is listening.  Who is Joe Black?  What is his relationship to Bill Parrish?  And most important, what is behind his influence on our Chairman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're building this thing up too much, Drew.  He's had advisors be- fore.  Nobody tells Bill what to do. The door opens and Felicia enters followed by Quince, sur prised at seeing a convened Board, but still he is all sm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Quince.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Ed, hi folks, I didn't know everybody was going to be here, what a nice surprise.  What's the big confab?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (acidly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a secret meeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Quince)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you'll respect its nature -- What we're trying to do here is gather our thoughts -- in light of Bill's rejection of Bontecou's offer -- and make an appropriate presenta- tion to him as to how we think the company might proceed.  Won't you share with our Board the information you gave me last night? Quince hesitates, then realizes what Drew has on his mind He nods confidently to Drew, then turns importantly to th Board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm happy to tell you I've got good news.  As I was telling Drew, I've been making a little hay while the Bontecou sun was shining -- two, possibly three new and boiling hot prospects for merger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did Bill react to the leads you've developed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was interested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (prompting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- But he was concerned about the timing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The timing -- yes.  He says it's up to Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'It's up to Joe'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what he said. Quince, having dispensed his information, looks proudly around at the Board members.  They are stunned, Sloane in shock.  Drew is absolutely still, letting Quince's words sink in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parrish, Joe, Susan, Allison and Quince are seated at the table, dessert plates in front of them, coffee cups besid Allison and Susan's eyes are on Parrish, looking for some clue as to why has he gathered the family together yet again.  Parrish is somewhat within himself, but he peeks over his demi-tasse cup at Joe, Parrish aware of Joe's heightened interest in Susan, and Susan's reciprocation. Coyle enters carrying two imposing stemmed silver trays w cakes on them, Luisa follows with one other.  They set th down in front of Parrish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie made them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Annie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From La Rosette, only the greatest pastry chef in America. (pointing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is orange, from real Seville oranges.  Lemon, on a mille-feuille crust, a little on the fanciful. And a while, nothing like a good old white cake, vanilla, with Angel food but some maroons shavings thrown in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like cake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's for the party, Dad --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, the goddam party --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Goddam party'! Allison bursts into tears. ALLISON (cont'd) (to Quince)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hear that? Quince quickly slashes a piece, takes a huge bite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is great, honey.  The orange. Has it got a little vodka in it? Like that Finnish stuff, orange vodka -- (to Parrish)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put your lips around this one, Bill. It's out of this world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thank you, Quince. (to Allison)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, honey.  I'm no good at this.  Why don't you choose whatever cake you like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew you were going to say that. Tito Puente.  The old platoon.  Now the cake.  You just don't care.  Why did I do this?  I should have my head examined.  I'm trying to throw the party for the century for my father - and you know what -- he doesn't give a shit. She bursts into tears all over again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he does give a shit.  Don't you, Bill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I give a shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See.  There.  What'd I tell you? Joe watches as Quince dabs at Allison's tears with a napk QUINCE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feel better?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What will I tell Annie? Parrish forks a bit of a cake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vodka.  What'd I tell you? Quince puts a reassuring arm around Allison, she seems to relax now, Joe has been a keen observer of what has trans pired between husband and wife, between man and woman, a sense that he has taken in the virtue of such a relation- ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After dinner, Parrish, Allison and Susan are gathered to- gether.  At the bar on the other side of the room, Joe watches as Quince pours himself a stiff hooker of brandy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Quince)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cirrhosis of the liver is the fifth leading killer of adult Western males.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the other hand, Winston Churchill drank a bottle of cognac a day and lived until he was ninety-one. After a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're an original, Joe.  A little hard to figure, maybe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're a nice man, Quince.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're welcome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drew appears unannounced in the doorway, exchanges a tens glance with Susan, then heads straight for Parrish who se surprised to see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Parrish)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry to intrude, Bill, but we've got a bit of a crisis downtown -- it's not something we could talk about on the phone. Parrish takes Drew aside. DREW (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Board's real unhappy, Pappy -- they felt you dealt with them pre- emptorily, you never gave them a chance to speak --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is there to say?  They know what John Bontecou is -- and if they didn't, they know now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, you made your feeling abun- dantly clear.  Now they want to do the same with theirs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are their feelings?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I read this Board right now, they want you to accept Bontecou's offer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over my dead body. Parrish's burgeoning anger has now gotten the attention o Joe, Susan, Quince and Allison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think the Board is going to say when I tell them that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With all due respect, you damn well better care because if you try to stonewall them again, there'll be blood on the floor. Silence, Parrish carefully calibrating Drew's remark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whose?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm feeling real uncomfortable right now because the guy who reports to me is threatening me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just giving you the truth.  There was a time when William Parrish liked the truth. Joe, although across the room, is all attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's time you went home, Drew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Certainly.  Goodnight. Drew goes, everybody is in shock, Susan pursues him out i the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drew! He stops. SUSAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never talk to my father like that again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about it.  There's a beginning and a middle and an end to everything.  And I think I've come to the end of my chapter with the Parrishes. Joe has followed them into the hallway. DREW (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the end began with this guy. Drew looks down towards Joe. DREW (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Black --?  We ran a check on you and you know what we came up with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not good, not bad, you know what we got?  Nothing.  No credit, no cars, no mortgages -- no wives.  Nothing. Joe waits. DREW (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of a sudden a guy appears on the scene with the Chairman of one of the greatest communications corpora- tions of the world, the boss makes him privy to all the company's secrets, he attends the Board meet- ings, and us working stiffs with MBA's up the ass and years and years and years of experience, we're left outside with our noses pressed against the window. Joe doesn't respond. DREW (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a big-time operation, deal- ing in big-time issues, demanding big-time executives who make big- time decisions.  So, Joe, why don't you tell me exactly what it is that's big time about you? After a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Drew)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you get off his case?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you're the great Joe's attorney now?  Are we going to go to court? Or are we going to go to bed?  And I don't mean you and me.  I mean you and him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it.  It's over.  Get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I guess a blowjob's out of the question? Joe clears his throat. DREW (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you say something? Joe considers him evenly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Drew)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said get out. Now Drew wheels, heads right for the front door and exits a SLAM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What an angry fellow. A moment passes before Susan realizes she and Joe are alo and Joe does as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry about --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.  We don't need to talk about Drew. She regards Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  We don't. They drift, osmotically, into the library in awkward sile SUSAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brave you had a chance to look at Dad's rare books?  Jefferson's Parliamentary Manual, a first edition Bleak House -- Joe comes closer, takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love your smell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I guess you haven't. Now Susan, close to Joe, leans closer, her nose in Joe's neck.  Joe holds himself very still. SUSAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like your smell, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was everything. Silence, the TICKING of the clock. SUSAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was little, my mother used to say, "Darling, you could set your heart by this clock".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Could you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never tried, 'til now. (suddenly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe, may I kiss you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, yes.  Thank you. A moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're welcome. Susan reaches out for Joe, they kiss, he is awkward but h very awkwardness endearing.  Susan pulls him closer, they linger now, mouths on each other's, then separate. SUSAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're welcome. The clock TICKS on.  A sense of foreboding falls over Joe face, his fear that he is passing through some barrier, a point of no return.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe? The apprehensive expression on Joe's face fades away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know who you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...I'm -- uh, Joe.  And you're Susan.  And I - uh - have this weak feeling in my knees --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And is your heart beating strangely?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faster.  And I want the scent from underneath your ears and the taste of your lips and the touch of your tongue to stay with me -- forever. An intake of breath.  She is about to speak. JOE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you don't even have to say a word. Their faces inches from each other's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go home. But neither Susan nor Joe moves. SUSAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't I? Her question makes Joe, almost involuntarily, smile.  Sus takes the opportunity to step back from him.  The SOUND o someone at the door, it is Parrish, Susan turns, comprehe immediately how the situation will appear to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight, Daddy. She drifts right past him, exits.  Joe and Parrish are le alone now, eyes on each other's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (carefully)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.  Would you like to join me, Quince and Allison for a nightcap?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um -- not right now. An awkward moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Goodnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight. Parrish turns and exits, Joe's head inclines, he breathes the scent of his collar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parrish, followed by Joe, emerges from his private elevat is greeted as usual:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, Mr. Parrish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, Jennifer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Board is waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't you call a Board meeting? Jennifer sees Parrish is trying to right his balance, she knows better than to press the point. JENIFER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, the members are waiting.  They are in the Board room now. Jennifer nods respectfully as Parrish doesn't cast a flic of any further surprise, heads straight for the Board roo Joe right beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parrish and Joe enter, the entire Board is assembled, inc ing Drew, Quince and Sloane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning. An odd mixture of responses, the Board sheepish and at th same time looking their most dutiful at this odd meeting, its sudden convening clearly a problem for Parrish, a pro lem which he does not attempt to hide, only control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you want to have a cup of coffee or something, Bill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.  Do you? Drew gets the message, at the same time Joe is checking o all the attendees, his eyes come to rest on Drew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Parrish)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To get to the point, we have re- ceived new information from John Bontecou concerning his desires for this company to merge with his, and we wanted to set the details before you. A moment as Parrish looks around, the moment extends, it appears he may not ever answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bontecou wants a quick response and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The answer is no, quick enough for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you want to hear the details?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not interested in the details. And I'm not interested in the big picture either.  What I am inter- ersted in is how my Board got conven- ed behind my back, is entertaining a further proposal from a man whom it offends me to do business with, moreover has the audacity to present this to me like a prize fish, and I am expected to clap for it like a performing seal.  No, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I am to understand from your re- sponse that you do not want to hear the details of Bontecou's offer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, you are to understand that, and now may I ask you a question?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Certainly, Bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you running this Board or am I? Sloane leans in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not getting anywhere here. Why don't we take some of the best out of this thing, let's consider it coolly, let's take a week --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bontecou wants a speedier response than that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll wait --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't need to.  Today, tomorrow, a week from now -- 'a week from now', who can think about a week from now -- the answer is going to be the same -- a loud, unmistakable, all-inclusive, airtight -- 'No'. A BUZZ amongst the Board, they finally rustle into silenc under Parrish's withering glance. PARRISH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it?  I've got a busy day and this meeting has already set me behind.  Shall we adjourn?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before we do, while we're here, there is a second question the Board would like a response to, a far simpler one. Parrish waits. DREW (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is the man sitting to the right of you? Everybody's eyes are on Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've already introduced Mr. Black to you all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But who is he?  What are his creden- tials?  What is his relationship to you? No response from Parrish. DREW (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The feeling of the Board is this: we fear Mr. Black is not only influenc- ing your decisions in regard to this company, but that you are relying on him to make them for you. Quince flinches at these words, his hands clasped in fron of him, his knuckles white as Parrish regards Drew, but s does not answer. DREW (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lack of response, Bill, is not appropriate.  We are your Board, we have a right to know how you are managing the operations of this company, and most importantly, that you have not delegated someone to do it for you. Parrish squirms, desperately uncomfortable but still does not speak. DREW (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, one more time. Drew regards Joe. DREW (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is Joe Black? Parrish stares stoically into the middle distance as Quince's head sinks into his hands. DREW (cont'd) (to the Board)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A motion has been brought before the Board to invoke Article 19 of the corporate charter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In English, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mandatory retirement upon our Chairman's sixty-fifth birthday. Parrish is expressionless. DREW (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At which time, the Chairman will be named Emeritus, he will be welcome to attend all meetings, and will serve as International Spokesman for the corporation plus, of course, a settlement, a golden parachute of such magnitude that his feet will never touch the ground. Drew pauses. DREW (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please indicate your vote by a "Yes" or "No". A "Yes" is heard, now another "Yes", now more "Yes"es, al reluctant, "No" from Sloane, "No" from Quince who realize he is the instrument of Parrish's dismissal. DREW (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The motion is passed.  We will of course delay the announcement, out of respect for our former Chairman, until after the celebration of his birthday this weekend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for allowing me to save face, Drew. Joe's eyes are riveted on Drew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the Board)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other motion before us is the acceptance of John Bontecou's offer to merge this corporation with Bontecou International -- Parrish stands, Drew stops speaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe? Silence, then Joe rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the Board)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who I am, and my relationship to Bill, will be divulged in our own good time. Joe follows Parrish out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sloane has pursued Parrish and Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Parrish)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...It's not over, 'til it's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Eddie, no 'Fat Lady Sings" shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still sense some doubt in this group, we could turn it around. You'll be up in the country?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, the big 'celebration' of my mandatory retirement birthday. You're an honored guest, Eddie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to stick it out here.  We still have a shot. The elevator door opens, Parrish and Joe step inside and door closes, leaving Sloane behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Board meeting has broken up, clusters of members have lingered, exchanging post-mortems.  And enraged Quince ha cornered Drew, out of earshot of the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have you done?  You've gotten the old man fired!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That we did.  Thanks to you.  He was wobbling, mind you, but you stupid the coup de grace. Quince falls silent, aquiver with this reality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to put a stop to this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quince, you can't unscramble scrambled eggs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I didn't mean to do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The train's left the station, pal, and you're aboard.  Would you like to hear the silver lining?  Check that, gold.  I've been working with John Bontecou all along.  We had a game plan -- acquire Parrish Communications then break it apart and peddle it piece-by-piece to the highest bidder.  I set it up for him, he smacks it out of the park. Quince is struck dumb. DREW (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you know what this'll mean? You'll be rich.  You'll sell your stock, you can stop kissing ass -- What'll it feel like to be a man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to get rich this way -- I'm going to expose you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go right ahead.  Tell William Parrish how you betrayed him at a secret Board meeting.  And tell Allison how you got her father fired -- and he lost his company. Quince goes ashen. DREW (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just life, Quin-cee. Drew hails an employee across the hall. DREW (cont'd) (to Quince)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wake up and smell the thorns. Drew joins the employee as Quince slumps against the wall

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parrish enters, Joe right behind him, Coyle takes their c disappears.  Parrish hesitates for a moment, shrugs as if has a thought he doesn't want to share, then heads upstai with Joe.  He is trudging a bit, Joe senses his mood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Bill --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's okay?
