dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a manner of speaking. Joe seems puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What 'okay' is, it's 'okay' it's over.  We've got bigger fish to fry, don't we, Joe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Fish'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind.  I'm tired.  I'm going to take a nap. A moment. PARRISH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you hungry?  Coyle will have Luisa fix you something to eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I can't help you. Parrish turns into his bedroom, closing the door gently behind him.  Joe continues down the hall, enters the gues wing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Midday sunlight streams into the sitting room, Joe passes through to his bedroom, sits tentatively on the bed, feel the edge of the silk spread, touches the pillow, then ris again, crosses back to the sitting room. Susan appears in the doorway, Joe suddenly senses her, tu around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am. He stands, they regard each other for the moment. JOE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I take your coat? She doesn't answer, starts to take off the coat herself, comes around her to help, Susan senses him breathing in t scent at the back of her neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just thought I'd drop by, scrounge a little lunch, I was in the neigh- borhood --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How beautiful. He starts to hang Susan's coat up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just throw it on the chair. Joe holds her coat carefully on the chair.  An awkward moment, the two of them shifting from foot-to-foot. SUSAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I called, they said that you and Daddy had just left the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's taking a nap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He must be tired -- this Bontecou thing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, he's tired.  I believe so. A moment. JOE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must be hungry? Susan sits on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not anymore.  Are you? Joe hears the question but doesn't answer, sits down on t couch beside her. SUSAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a moment) Are you cold?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's the draft through the door. She gets up, closes the door, sits back down again next t Joe.  A warm, awkward silence, they move closer to each other, now they fall into a foreplay which Susan recogniz as such, Joe, on the other hand, participates hungrily bu has no knowledge where it is leading.  His movements are instinctive, the smell of her hair, the shape of her fin- gers, odd things about her seem to interest him.  This excites her because she senses his untutoredness and the very sense of that stirs her, their reactions to each oth are intuitive and spontaneous; even though Joe has no kno ledge of how to make love to a woman, ironically his acti are such that they never beg the question -- has he done before. Strange territory for Joe, not to be 'in control' and exe ing his power, but his inventions and responses in lovema ing are so real that an emotional exchange between he and Susan builds.  Joe has found himself in an unexplored lan of feeling and passion, he loves what is happening and ye at the same time, is terrified by it.  He feels himself b lured by some power he has not only never been aware of, is deeply dangerous to partake of; he knows what he is do is putting who he is at great risk, yet he goes right on. The powerful contradiction is transmitted to Susan, and i the end there is the knowledge they have together made a journey, they both have been swept away in a stream of ev they have created; and they don't care about the conseque Spent, they lie in silence.  Finally Susan speaks:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's so wonderful to make love to you.  It's like making love to some- one who has never made love before. Joe senses an opportunity not only to admit to what she h said, but to tell her more, even the truth about himself. He weighs, then resists, the impulse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Her head nestles underneath his arm, she has a sense of h comforting her without knowing that he is doing so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you like making love to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I loved it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More than you love peanut butter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! She laughs at the earnestness with which he answers. Joe seems to drift away now, they lie together as one but the first time, she feels separate from him, sensing him to some distant, distant land.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nowhere?  I'm...here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For how long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I hope a long, long time. A moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me, too. Another moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we do now? She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will come to us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe and Susan are at the front door, he has helped her on with her coat, she turns around, they kiss.  The kiss lingers, Susan breaks away, reaches for the door, looks b longingly at Joe and then she is gone, Joe closing the do softly after her. He turns back into the foyer, looks up, Parrish is on the balcony, it is clear he has observed Joe and Susan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Bill. Parrish, in a state of shock, doesn't answer for a moment JOE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you have a nice nap?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry to hear that. He starts up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'll come down Joe waits guardedly at the bottom of the stairs as Parris descends. PARRISH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on? Joe senses Parrish's tone, doesn't answer. PARRISH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw you kiss Susan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I saw you see me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you're at the wrong place at the wrong time with the wrong woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be the judge of that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm her father!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With all due respect, Bill, I'm not asking your permission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you goddam well should.  You walk into my life, give me the worst news a guy can get, have me dancing on the heads of pins with my busi- ness and with my family, and now you're spooning with my daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Spooning'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, and stop repeating everything I sai, and turning it into a question. Spooning, fooling around, God knows what.  You arrive on the scene -- why you picked me, I still don't under- stand --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I picked you for your verve, your excellence, and for your ability to - how shall I say - instruct.  You've lived a first-rate life.  And I find it eminently usable. Parrish measures Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want? Joe doesn't answer, riveted now on Parrish. PARRISH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody wants something, Joe. You've been taking me from pillar to post here.  I thought I knew who you were, and it wasn't a whole lot of fun, however it was almost bear- able.  Now I'm getting something else from you, something very, very strange -- what is it that you want, Joe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm only following the Parrish bywords.  Looking for that 'ounce of excitement', that 'whisper of a thrill' -- What there is no sense living your life without.  You know what I mean, Bill. Parrish's jaw sets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're violating the laws of the universe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This universe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any universe that exists or ever existed.  You may be the pro, Joe. But I know who you are.  And you're all fucked up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like your tone, and I don't like your references.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I don't give a shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I remind you this is not just a dispute with a putative suitor, this is me.  So watch it...Bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut the 'Bill' crap out -- you sonofabitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you, 'watch it'. Silence.  Now Joe turns on his heel, heads right out the front door.  Parrish is left solitary, confounded, starin at the closed door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe walks down a hallway, a bouquet of flowers in hand, looks around the usual feverish activity, he seems lost f the moment, but a Receptionist catches his eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Parrish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She comes on at 6.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. He looks at the flowers, regards them for a moment, then heads for an elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easter is sitting up in bed, hooked up to an TV and moni- tors.  She glances over at the doorway, Joe is standing there, observing her.  An awkward silence, he looks at his flowers again, now sets them respectfully on Easter's bedstand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mistah Bad News.  'Bout time you show up. Joe speaks to her in the dialect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don' be facety, woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None facety, mistah.  You come for me?  Dat's good news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I come to see Doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor?  What could be wrong wit' you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nuthin'. Silence, then Easter smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you come to see Doctor Lady?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Doctor Lady?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mine, too. She thinks about this for the moment, Joe grows uncomfort able.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You in love? Joe seems slightly tormented by the question, Easter sens him trying to frame a respect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You loved back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She knows you real self?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She knows how she feel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scoffing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rass!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (irritably)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don' need you okayin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Schoolboy tings is you head. Badness for you, badness for her, badness for me, lyin' here tumor, big as breadfruit, poison my inners an' waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brung you flowers and all I gettin's facety back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stubbornly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only flowers I wan' see's one's over my peaceful self restin' in the dutty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can do no right by people.  Come to take, you wan' to stay, leave you stay, you wan' to go.  Rahtid! Silence, Easter waits, watching Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You not in you right place, mistah. Easter's response stops Joe cold, he looks away and then back at her, she had clearly reached him. EASTER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain' either.  No more.  You come wi' me now.  Take me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I not lonely here.  Somebody want me here. Easter considers Joe, she smiles sympathetically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It nice it happen to you.  It like you came to Cat Island and you had a holiday, sun didn't burn you red, just brown, sleep no mosquito eat you, rum no poung you head nex' day. But trut' is, dat bound to happen, you stay long enough.  So tak dat nice picture home wi' you, but don' be fooled.  We lonely here mostly, too.  If we lucky, we got some nice pictures. Easter drifts into silence, her eyes and Joe's meet, a se they understand each other.  Easter shifts, trying hard t ease her discomfort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got enough nice pictured, Easter. She looks at him and nods gratefully and closes her eyes. Joe watches her, now his eyes close.  Easter exhales raspingly, falls still.  The monitors flatline.  A beepin alarm sound somewhere down the hall. Joe opens his eyes, takes a deep breath, he seems trouble JOE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: G'bye, sistah. She slips out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parrish is playing solitaire.  The SOUND of the front doo closing, HEELS crossing the foyer, he looks up, at the fo door is Susan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, honey. He starts to get up, she motions to him to stay, looks around now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Joe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe? A silence. PARRISH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe's not around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Susan seems distracted. PARRISH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you looking for Joe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I was sitting in a staff meeting, incredibly bored, my mind kept wandering and the only place it landed was -- Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love.  Passion.  Obsession, all those things you told me to wait for.  Well, they've arrived. Parrish blinks, stares down at his cards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is crazy --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?  A man appears at your side, almost never leaves it, you clearly trust him, depend on him, I sense you value him deeply, why aren't those things good enough for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know anything about Joe --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you afraid of, Dad?  That I'll fall head over heels for Joe -- well, I have -- as you did with Mom. (a moment)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's always been standard, whether you like or not. Parrish tries to get hold of himself, changes gear now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan, I don't think Joe is going to be with us long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's he going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, I can't say --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon!  The guy's working with you. You always know chapter and verse about everyone who works --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In this case, I can't.  I - uh -- I just can't help you.  I only would tell you -- that with Joe, you are on very, very dangerous ground. Susan doesn't answer for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care if you love him!  I'm telling you he's no good for you! A moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course not, Daddy.  I'm sorry. There is something in Susan's tone that lets him know not word has sunk in.  Parrish slumps. SUSAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, too. She kisses Parrish, rearranges one of his ranks of cards, shuffles through the deck, turns over the top card, lays down a card Parrish needs. SUSAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lightning does strike. Parrish watches as Susan turns, disappears out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe walking disconcertedly up the street, bumping shoulde with the rush hour crowd, trapped in the life of the city he peers intently at faces, cars, into store windows.  He stops now at the window of a Korean grocery, something ha caught his eye, he steps inside. Through the window, Joe can be seen making a purchase, he hands the Korean Clerk some money, walks out. Joe, back on the street now, unscrews the top of a jar of peanut butter, dips a wad out with his fingers.  The Kore Clerk runs out after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Change!  Change! Joe stops, uncomprehending.  The Clerk hands Joe bills an coins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you giving me money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am who I am.  I cannot change. Joe tries to hand the money back, but the baffled Clerk refuses it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You change!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's impossible.  You're wasting your money.  I couldn't change even if I wanted to. The Clerk, exasperated, murmurs something in his language and returns to the store.  Joe continues on down the stre

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parrish is sitting in a wing chair staring at the fire. appears in the doorway, Parrish doesn't notice him.  Joe waits, finally Parrish looks up.  They regard each other. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I have the feeling that, all in all, what I made this voyage for -- has served its purpose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you saying, that it's time to go? Joe doesn't respond, Parrish and Joe measure each other f the moment. PARRISH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.  Tomorrow, after the party. Parrish nods, Joe nods back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bird's eye view of the Hudson, over the George Washingt Bridge, past the widest expanse of the river at the Tappa Zee, coming in now over the great lawns and old estates o the Upper Hudson Valley, down towards Annadale-on-Hudson and the Parrish country estate, which commands a beehive activity, tents and workmen and vehicles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Parrish AStar sets down in its roped-off landing area The Butler runs towards it to open the door, Parrish and Joe disembark.  Following the Butler, they make their way through the maelstrom: tents being raised, platforms for music groups, portable pools with clusters of florists leaning over the edge to arrange lily pads within.  Parri and Joe move solemnly, observing the activity, not speaki to one another.  Although they are shoulder-to-shoulder, there is a distance between them.  They walk on past chan deliers in the garden and fake trees with lights woven through their branches.  Adding to the confusion, the ASt lifts off, the chandeliers rocking and floral pools rippl from the blast of the rotors.  May, the housekeeper, appe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Parrish)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Telephone call, sir.  Mr. Sloane from New York. Parrish nods, starts up for a wing off the main house, Jo right at his side.  Parrish stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. Joe, not knowing whether to be affronted or not, hesitate and Parrish strides away.  Joe does not follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A low-slung but well-appointed room with a writing table, working fireplace, expensive and appropriate Hudson Valle prints. Parrish enters, clicks on the SPEAKERPHONE, observes the party activity through a wide, bow window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (speakerphone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah - Bill - How are you?  You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, fine.  Big doing up here.  Why are you still down here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (speakerphone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Board's working through the weekend, trying up the loose ends this damn thing.  But I want to give it one more try, I'm still holding out some hope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie, hold out all the hope you want but, I promise you, it's hope- less, it's over.  Come on up, let's get drunk, if I had your shoulder to lean on I might actually enjoy this --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (speakerphone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm going to stay down here, keep my finger in the dike and maybe by Monday, the waters could recede.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're trying to show me lay- down-in-front-of-the-bus loyalty, forget it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (speakerphone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Bill, have a drink, eat your cake, blow out the candles and make a wish.  Talk to you Monday.  Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Eddie -- anyway, thanks for the memory. Parrish clicks off the SPEAKERPHONE, turns around and loo out the window again, the party preparations in full swin colored lights are tested, they flicker on and off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allison is everywhere, Parrish emerges from his wing, she catches his eye immediately, the calm director of a DeMil like epic, politely giving workers instructions, making lightning decisions. Parrish turns his attention now to an ice-filled fountain encircling two giant topiary letters written in faux- Cyrillic, a 'B' and a 'P', as rubber-booted delivery men carefully arrange giant ice chests of caviar under each letter.  A smile creases Parrish's face as, in an unexpec lull, Allison backs into him at the fountain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Daddy, what do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's starting to grow on me.  But what do the 'B' and 'P' mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fountain is the Caspian Sea and the Sea is serving up caviar.  The 'B's for Beluga, the 'P' for Petrossian.  Of course, they also stand for 'Bill' and for 'Parrish'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do they, m'dear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Plus we've got a baritone with a balalaika coming from The Russian Tea Room.  I've dressed him in a Cossack shirt and he'll sing Nelson Eddy songs. Parrish shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are amazing.  Why, oh why, Allison, are you doing all this? But before she can answer, a workman is tugging at Alliso sleeve, she turns away from Parrish to give him instructi out of Parrish's earshot, and then turns back, they step now, daughter and father, alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do it because I love you.  Because everybody I loved you.  Mommy -- wher- ever she is -- Susan, Quince, the people who work for you, everybody who's ever known you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?  And what about my enemies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They respect you.  Isn't that a kind of love? Unexpectedly, Allison brushes a lock away from Parrish's forehead, with a flick she has rearranged his hair, he blinks, a little embarrassed, but having liked it. ALLISON (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Above all, you've been a wonderful father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't been the father to you that --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That you've been to Susan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't going to say --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that's what you were thinking. And that's okay.  Because I know you love me.  Not like it is with Susan, the way your eyes light up when she comes in the room and the way she always gets a laugh out of you, as opposed to me when I walk in a room and that look comes over your face, "What does she want now?" A weather-beaten military parade ground pennant passes, 2 Infantry Regiment  "C" (Charlie) Company. ALLISON (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I already feel I've had everything I could have wanted for my birthday --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, there's lots to come. (gesturing to me activity)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little excess -- like you love. The preparations are building to a climax, all the elabor plans coming to fruition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, darling, this is going to be a wonderful party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it is. Allison wades into the maelstrom now, Parrish watches her go, swarms of purveyors and caterers following her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ambrose, the head caterer, is making a last minute check of the bar's stock, Quince ambles up, in the background t activity has built to a pitch, waiters adjusting their un forms, purveyors' trucks pulling out in a cloud of dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me a Seagrams and '7'. Ambrose looks at him blankly. QUICNCE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No got?  Okay a double V.O., water back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid this is a wine bar, Mr. Quince.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, give me a bottle of wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red or white?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both. Joe appears, looking bewildered, jostled by caterers sett up last-minute tables, a drummer from the band rolls his traps past on a little cart.  Joe doesn't seem to know wh he is, when his eyes alight on Quince, he heads for this oasis.  Ambrose sets down two bottles of wine and departs QUINCE (cont'd) (to Joe)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red or white?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, thank you. Quince sips the red, now the white, now he pours some of each into one glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, have a drink.  You look like you need one bad as me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I?  I'm a little confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Confused, huh?  About what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Love'?  Oh, man, I've got troubles of my own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You love Allison, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes, I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you meet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was a world-class loser and she was a happy, little rich girl -- and for some reason she took me in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she loves you? Quince smiles, nods embarrassedly. JOE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because there's nothing we don't know about each other and it's okay. I mean the deeper, darkest secrets -- they don't matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'The deepest, darkest secrets --'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's like you know every inch of each other's souls -- and then you're free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean 'free'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Free to love each other.  Com- pletely.  Totally.  No fear. Quince seems uncharacteristically within himself. QUINCE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All that hoopla up there reminds me how I will never measure up to a man like Bill Parrish - or his daughter. He drains his wine. QUINCE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you like me, Joe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes, you are one of my favorites.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you say if you knew it was me who brought down Bill Parrish? (a moment)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told Drew and the Board that Bill depended on you.  Drew led me on, but I had no business telling him in the first place.  He was setting up Bill from day one.  Drew and Bontecou are going to chop up the company and sell it off for parts. Bontecou was outside, Drew was Mr. Inside.  And I was the fool who made it all happen.  Oh God, what do I do? Joe regards Quince.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to Bill Parrish and tell him everything.  He'll forgive you. Quince drains one more glass of wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think so?  How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because that's the kind of man Bill Parrish is. A moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, maybe... I guess you know him better than anybody. Another moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Getting to. The orchestra behind them plays a few riffs, sound checks getting close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think I should wait to tell him 'till after the party?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Quince nods anxiously, then smiles gratefully.  They look as the pre-party activities swirl on around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The moment just before sunset, the last pre-party minutes a procession of guests' cars winding up to the guest hous being directed into adjacent fields.  Susan cuts past a r ceiving line that files up the stairs, she skirts the hou and heads straight for the action, the party on the lawns the rear, climbs a terrace where she commands a view of t event on which the curtain is just about to rise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guests milling, emerging from the crowd Susan sees, isola by a fountain, Joe.  He looks up towards her, he knows sh has seen him, they proceed to a rendezvous that has not b prearranged but which they intuit.  Susan slants through guests, stopping here and there, excited greetings and ch tter float on the wind, "He, Susie!",  "What a party",  " look great", she keeps moving, a shimmering wraith. Joe is on the right coordinate to meet her, his graceful, unfailing step carrying him speedily to a destination he not certain of, but where he knows he will find Susan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The very last rays of the sun setting over the wide expan of river, the light catching Susan and Joe as they enter garden, the party forming behind them, the river flowing front of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like you in a black tie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you in an evening gown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It beats a surgical, doesn't it? He smiles. SUSAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy told me you might be leaving?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  Your father and I, our time together has come to an end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going? Joe attempts to answer, but nothing comes out. SUSAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well -- I --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you can't tell me who you are. Again the same indescribable gesture from Joe. SUSAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in love with a man, I don't know who he is, where he's going or when.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can tell you the when part.  Tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It gets worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No worse than it gets for me.  I'm in love with a woman whom I don't want to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then don't. A moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We know so little about each other --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We know all that we need to know --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But there's so much to tell you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't.  That will come later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lightning struck.  We caught it in a bottle.  Don't let it out.  I want to be with you, Joe -- Another moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What will we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Love will find out the way'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Love will find out the way'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a saying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe that, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, that's why I said it. They are on the brink of some decision, Joe is about to m some declaration when Allison is heard --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you are! Allison appears. ALLISON (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on here?  Tete-a-tetes on my big night? (to Susan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon honey, you're needed. (to Joe)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can it wait? But before he can answer -- ALLISON (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glad to hear it! (to Susan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go. She takes Susan's arm and marches her off, Joe, in thrall watches them go as the MUSIC erupts behind them, as 'up' dance tune, a lilting, catchy melody envelops them all. curtain has risen on William Parrish's 65th birthday part

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quince is "on the carpet", sweating through a confession, Parrish moroses but  philosophical at his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...what can I say after I say that I'm sorry?  I zipped when I should've zagged, I opened my big mouth one too many times, everything got all twisted --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, Quince.  I understand. You've always meant well and I appreciate that.  Sometimes things just turn out -- wrong. A KNOCK on the door, it opens, Joe appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me -- He starts to step out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in, Joe -- I want to thank you -- okay, Bill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. As Joe enters, Quince flashes a warm smile at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Parrish)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe knew the whole story.  I told him.  It was his idea that I come clean.  I mean I wanted to come clean but he gave me a pair of balls, you know what I mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I believe I do. Quince now drifts off. QUICHE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well -- I can tell you guys got business --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm out of business, right, Quince?  However I do have some unfinished business -- with Drew. Get him out here.  Get him on the chopper and get him out here to- night.  I want to tell this guy how I feel about him face-to-face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that could be a tall order, B.P. I doubt that Drew's anxious to see you face-to-face. Joe steps in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Quince)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell Drew that Bill acknowledges that this was a contest and he's lost.  The race is to the swift, but could Drew summon a modicum of understanding and allow Bill to save face.  Tell him Bill wants it understood in the business community he has merely moved upstairs in his own company, and the executive continuity is unbroken.  Tonight's the night to do it.  He'll introduce Drew to his press friends as well as some of his close acquaintances from Washington and Drew can tell them that everything's sailing along just fine. Parrish is impressed by Joe's acumen, a look of grudging admiration.  He nods to Joe, summarizes:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Quince)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All in all, what Bill wants to do is build the golden bridge to Drew with no hard feelings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think Drew will go for it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quince, I've got confidence in you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I'll deliver the package. He heads out, Parrish and Joe fall silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not at all. A moment. JOE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell do you care?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just asking, Bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You 'want to know', I'll tell you. You're looking at a man who tonight is not about to walk through the Valley of the Shadow of Death, he's galloping into it.  And the same time, the business he built with his own hands and his own head is being commandeered by a couple of cheap pirates.  And, oh yes, I almost forgot, my daughter's fallen in love with Death. Another moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- And I'm in love with your daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in love with your daughter, and I'm taking her with me tonight. Parrish is stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you heard me, Bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not taking Susan anywhere. And what the hell does that mean anyway? Joe doesn't answer for a moment. PARRISH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought we had a deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Bill --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan is my daughter, she has a wonderful life ahead of her and you're going to deprive her of it and you're telling me you're sorry?  Well, I'm sorry, apology not accepted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love her, Bill.  She is all that I ever wanted, and I've never wanted for anything because I've never wanted anything before, if you can understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How perfect for you -- to take whatever you want because it pleases you.  It's not love --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some aimless infatuation in which, for the moment, you feel like in- dulging.  It's missing everything that matters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which is what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust, responsibility, taking the weight, for your choices and feel- ings and spending the rest of your life living up to them.  And above all, not hurting the object of your love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So that's what love is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Multiply it by infinity and take it to the death of forever and you will still have barely a glimpse of what I am talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those were my words, Bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, they're mine now. Joe is silent for a moment, cogitating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan wants to come.  She says she's in love with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With you?!  Who is 'you'?  Did you tell her who you are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does she know where she's going? Joe doesn't answer. PARRISH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan went, in whatever way she did, for that poor sonofabitch whose body you took, and everything else since has been aftermath.  You say you love her but you don't know what love is. She 'loves' you but she doesn't know who you are.  You make a deal, you're breaking it -- the bottom line is, Joe, you're conducting a Great Romance under false pretenses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like what you're saying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't expect you to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you threatening me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I certainly hope so -- I loved Susan from the moment she was born, and I love her now, and every minute in between, and what I dream of is a man who will discover her and she will discover a man who will love her, who is worthy of her, who is of this world, of this time and has the grace and compassion and fortitude to walk beside her as she makes her way through this beautiful thing called life. Parrish is beginning to reach Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you telling me I can't be part of it? A pause, Parrish's posture changes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you come in here and tell me, Joe?  You are the Biggest Shot of all, you don't have to ask my permission, but that's what you're doing.  You know why?  Because you've somewhere, somehow, developed into a good guy, and you know this is all wrong... I don't know what you're going to do -- how can this be love? She doesn't know who you are.  Why don't you tell her?  Try it out on her?  See what happens.  Reveal everything there is to know about yourself and let the chips fall where they may. Joe has received what Parrish has said. PARRISH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay? -- I've given it my best shot. I wish I could tell you to sleep on it but... Parrish lets his words drift into silence, he shrugs, Joe regards him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe makes his way down the path from Parrish's study, a weight on his shoulders, his step measured, within himsel until he is hit by the lights and laughter and MUSIC of t party.  He drifts into the center and runs right into Sus couples swirl about them, the eye of a storm of gaiety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Joe.  What'd you know? She smiles. SUSAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something so indescribably sexy about you in a crowd.  I could make love to you right here. He hesitates, reaches out to take her hand, studies it. SUSAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're going to tell my future, you're on the wrong side. A moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is something I do want to tell you -- He stammers into silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you can't. Joe is about to respond but doesn't. SUSAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then -- when you hesitated -- the way you shift from foot-to-foot, I've always found endearing but just now -- I got a chill. But he drifts again, now she takes his hand. SUSAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember that morning in the coffee shop?  You said 'What's wrong with taking care of a woman, she takes care of you --"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I say that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I said you'd have a hard time finding a woman like that. Joe shifts, she smiles at his embarrasement. SUSAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you've found one, Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The 'coffee shop' --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- That was the place... and you were the guy. Joe seems resigned now, the air gone out of him. SUSAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you said you didn't want me to be your doctor because you didn't want me to examine you --? (a moment)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I got to examine you after all -- Joe blinks, at a loss. SUSAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could come with you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I - uh --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to wait for you, you'll be back -- Joe doesn't answer, Susan is suddenly anxious. SUSAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do I want this night to last forever?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you know, that's what I want more than anything. He touches her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said before you couldn't tell me who or where, only the 'when' -- Is when now? A moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I kiss you? She waits.  He kisses her, they fall into a deep embrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That felt like a goodbye. Joe's silence is heavy. SUSAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on, Joe?  I feel like we're lifting off --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm still here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you're not.  You're somewhere else. (a moment)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're someone else -- Joe is struggling with a response, finally, inevitably, h drifts into a long silence.  Susan is beside herself, her emotions tossed in every direction, Joe steadies her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me you love me -- tell me you love me now --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you now, I'll love you always --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold me -- He holds on tight to her.  They are desperately entwined until finally she releases him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for loving me. She smiles wanly, Joe leaves her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parrish is seated by the window, lights from the party flashing past, the MUSIC and laughter audible but muted, the fever of the celebration lost on him, within himself. Joe enters, Parrish looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...We should think about getting started, Bill. Parrish waits. JOE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll just be us. The tension in Parrish's body releases, he takes a breath

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Joe nods an acknowledgement, but his face reflects his pa Parrish regards him sympathetically. The silence is broken by a KNOCK on the door.  Parrish, o of politeness to Joe, does not respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill --? After a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in. Quince appears, flushed with excitement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I got him.  The chopper's two minutes away. Parrish weighs the information for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Joe)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are we on time? Joe shrugs, nods gently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Quince)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get him in here. Quince exits, Parrish presses the button for the speaker- phone. PARRISH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...May? -- I know you're busy,  but I want you to put in a call to Eddie Sloane for me --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At home, sir --?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, he's at the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An area on the fringe of the party, the helicopter blades stop spinning.  Quince hurries to the aircraft door, open it and Drew steps out.  Quince leads the way through the lights and MUSIC.  Drew, fashioning an imperial entrance himself, hails partygoers as he passes, Quince enjoying t irony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is damn big of Bill, I also think it's smart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had no choice.  You're a formidable adversary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you've got him by the short- hairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, the short, gray hairs. He flashes a pleased-as-punch greeting to some unseen acquaintance as they press on to Parrish's study.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parrish is at his desk, Joe in a distant corner of the ro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (speakerphone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're all here, Bill --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I appreciate this, Eddie, members of the Board, this will just take a minute of your time.  As the custo- dians of the company, you may re- ceive information from what follows that is valuable to you -- (a moment)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- or not.  Either way, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (speakerphone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're all ears. Drew enters with Quince, Quince nods, excusing himself, a closes the door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Bill, happy birthday -- A moment. DREW (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanted to say how appre- ciative I am of this - uh - grand gesture and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up and sit down. Drew takes a seat. PARRISH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a worthless sack of shit, you fucked me over, played footsie with John Bontecou, sold my company out to line your own pockets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know where you get that idea -- the Board agreed --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Board didn't know you're a mole who burrowed inside so you could bury us all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this Mr. Black's fantasy?  Another one of his whoppers?  Aren't you sick of this asshole lurking around? No one knows who he is, but one thing everyone does know, he somehow got your ear and has been pouring poison into it ever since. Joe can no longer control himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the poison, Drew.  You've operated behind-the-scenes to suborn the trust of a man who has stamped you with his imprimatur of class and elegance and stature.  I've seen all kinds and degrees of deception in my time, but Bill Parrish has been on the receiving end of machinations so Machiavellian that it has rarely been my experience to encounter.  And yet he has combatted them stoically, and selflessly, without revealing my identity.  Had he violated the vow of secrecy he took, his task would have been far easier, he could have turned defeat into victory, but he is too honorable a man to have done that.  And now I must release him from that vow.  Because of me, he has lost his work, his company, his reputation -- and now he's going to tell you who I am. Parrish is struck dumb.  He looks at Joe pleadingly, shak his head imperceptibly, but Joe nods to him blithely -- a then commandingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Parrish)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So tell me, tell me, I'm peeing in my pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- And now you're going to pee some more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe, don't do this --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's time to put this person where he belongs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not necessary, Joe.  Drew's going to step aside --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not stepping anywhere --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I appreciate your gentlemanliness, Bill, but what we need to do here is drive the dagger home --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dagger --?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you to shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Drew)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prepare yourself, Drew - I am --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take it from here -- (to Drew)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- An IRS man. Drew is stunned, Joe glances at Parrish, hesitates. PARRISH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, he is.  He's an -- IRS man. Aren't you, Joe? Joe is at a loss, Parrish's eyes are glued to his, Joe ge the hint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I am. (to Drew)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IRS man. Drew's head swivels from Joe to Parrish and back again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Treasury Department asked my cooperation in his undercover investigation of John Bontecou. They were convinced that Bontecou, on past deals, had structured his mergers and acquisitions in sus- picious and complicated ways so as to evade paying the taxes he is liable for.  The IRS wanted to go after him, and this deal offered them the opportunity. (a moment)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I agreed to cooperate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Parrish)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we're very grateful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moreover, Agent Joe Black here -- of course that's not his real name -- smelled out your involvement, Drew.  He developed evidence you were working both sides of the fence.  Unfortunately, that's known as a conflict of interest --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Undisclosed conflict of interest --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An offense --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An indictable offense. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'd like to talk to my lawyer --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No lawyers, Drew.  We're going to offer you a deal. Drew is all attention. PARRISH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Confess to the Board every details of your participation and then submit your resignation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what do I get?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get not to go to jail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're talking through your hat. You're offering a deal because you've got no proof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Proof?  We've got plenty of proof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Drew)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he's talking through his lips. Joe steps forward. JOE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make no mistake, Drew, if you choose to test my resolve in this matter, you'll be looking at an outcome that will have a finality that is beyond your comprehension, and you'll not be counting the days or the months or the years, but millenniums in the house with no doors. Drew slumps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, you win.  As soon as I get back to the city, I'll meet with the Board. Sloane's voice erupts over the SPEAKERPHONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're meeting with the Board right now, Drew.  Resignation accepted. Moreover, I propose a motion to re- confirm William Parrish as Chairman of the Board of Parrish Communica- tions as well as a rejection of the merger with Bontecou International. How say you, Board? A chorus of thunderous "Yes"es resounds through the SPEAKERPHONE. SLOANE (O.S., cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The motion is passed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, thank you, that's great, but it's more than I bargained for.  I just wanted to set the record straight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we want you back, Bill.  Mean- while, enjoy your party, celebrate, we'll attend to the nasty details. And Mr. Black, may we say thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My pleasure.  This is an IRS Agent's dream.  I'll be promoted to Chief of Section off of this. Parrish clicks the speakerphone off.  Drew is staring at Joe, shaking his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who would've ever believed it?  You, an IRS Agent -- Silence.  Joe shrugs, smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Death and Taxes'. The door flies open, an anxious Allison appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy!  We've been looking all over for you - this is your party - what are you doing in here?  Never mind. You're on.  Let's go. She pulls him out of his chair, hustles him out of the ro Joe right behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guests have formed themselves into a huge audience, t orchestra strikes up "Happy Birthday" as Parrish appears with Allison.  An enormous cake is unveiled with one grea lit candle, Parrish beams then laughs.  He pauses over th cake, now blows the candle out.  APPLAUSE, cries of "Spee Speech!", Parrish tries to demur but the request becomes loud and rhythmic, he holds up his hand, nods, quiets the crowd.  Joe observes from the fringe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the guests)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I was going to sneak away tonight... YELLS of "No!"  "Never!" PARRISH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...What a glorious night, every face I see is a memory.  It may not be a perfectly perfect memory -- sometimes we had our ups and downs -- but we're all together, and you're mine for a night. (a moment)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- And I'm going to break precedent, and tell you my one-candle wish -- that you would have a life as lucky as mine, where you can wake up one morning and say "I don't want anything more." (another moment)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sixty-five years - don't they go by in a blink? Parrish hesitates, waves and steps away, APPLAUSE that gr into CHEERS, the music resumes, another dance tune.  Quin grabs him, pumps his hand and claps him on the back.  Now Parrish spots Allison, he wraps her in a tight embrace, t hold each other close for a moment, but then are separate by a surge of guests.  Parrish sees Susan, she smiles but there is a tinge of sadness about her.  He heads towards they are somehow situated as if they were alone in this c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm having a helluva time. A moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were right about Joe, he is going somewhere --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. Susan is examining Parrish very closely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you relieved?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but -- Parrish hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to know how much I love you.  That you've given a meaning to my life that I had no right to expect, and that no one can ever take from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- I love you so much and I want you to promise me something.  I don't want you to ever worry about me.  If anything should happen, I'm going to be fine and everything's going to be all right. (a moment)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- And I have no regrets. Susan is in pain now, she can't summon an answer. PARRISH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I want you to feel that way, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, Daddy --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why it's okay. They drift into silence. PARRISH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No regrets? After a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'No regrets'. A long silence, Susan smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a good feeling, isn't it? Silence again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody's saying goodbye... They regard each other, a long pause, they have reached a understanding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm still here. (a moment)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like to dance with me, Susan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yes -- He starts to lead her to the floor, immediately stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you don't mind dancing with an old fogey like me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Dad, you're not old.  You'll never be old. He takes her in his arms and they dance away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a distant fringe of the party, a grass terrace that st commands a view of the dance floor, is Joe.  His eyes are Parrish and Susan, he watches them admiringly yet ruefull A Waiter passes, catches sight of Joe, stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I get you anything, sir? Joe regards the Waiter for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have any peanut butter? The Waiter hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, anyway. The Waiter moves off.  Joe's attention returns to Parrish Susan, the dance number ends, a BOOM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the dance floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fireworks are about to start. Parrish looks up, sees Joe up on the terrace, waiting. SUSAN (cont'd) (to Parrish)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shall we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You go ahead, honey, I'm going to catch my breath. Suddenly he hugs her, holds her very close.  She looks at him, he smiles, nods, but doesn't release her until she smiles back.  Now she heads out with the crowd for the fireworks.  When Parrish senses she is on her way, he tur and heads up towards Joe. Joe rises to meet Parrish as he approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy Birthday, Bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. They watch the guests gathering to view the fireworks. Joe's gaze lingers. PARRISH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you say goodbye?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess you have your reasons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that we have a moment, would you mind if I expressed my gratitude for what you did for Susan? Joe waits. PARRISH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never heard her speak of any man as she spoke of you -- It was always what I wanted for her -- but what happens to her now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't worry about it, Bill. These things have a way of working out. Joe regards Parrish, waits until he has a sense that Parr has accepted what Joe has said, then Joe continues: JOE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And would you mind if I expressed my gratitude...? Parrish waits. JOE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For you.  For the time you've given me.  For the person you are. A moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't blow smoke up my ass, you'll ruin my autopsy. Joe barely manages a smile, now looks back longingly at t crowd below, searching. PARRISH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's hard to let go, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's life.  What can I tell you? A silence, an understanding there is another more to say. Joe looks inquiringly at Parrish as if to say "Shall we?" Parrish nods and Joe turns with him.  They set off now aw from the party, up a meadow that leads to a hill overlook the river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down below, the party guests' faces are lit by the initia fireworks display.  Among them is Susan, but her interest isn't there.  Not something pulls her attention, an over- powering feeling that compels her to turn and see, at a distance, Parrish and Joe walking away up the meadow.  So thing about the sight saddens and at the same time fright her, she turns back to the party, dazed, tracing on the fireworks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up the hill Parrish's step slows, Joe slowing with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm getting a little dizzy, I can feel my heart pumping -- But Parrish doesn't wait for a response, just continues o up the meadow, towards the rise of the hill, Joe in step with him. PARRISH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should I be afraid? Joe stops, Parrish stops with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a man like you. Parrish smiles faintly, takes a deep breath, he strides out again, Joe right with him.  In tandem they continue on and disappear over the crest of the hill.  A barrage of fireworks lights up the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down below, Susan, in a pained reflex, again turns and lo up towards the hill.  There is nobody there.  She hesitat now glides away from the party, her step quickens as she walks up towards the hill. Susan halts, in the distance a figure is approaching from over the crest of the hill where Joe and Parrish disappea He is heading straight for her, she tries to make him out seems to recognize him, starts to walk towards him as if pulled by a magnet.  Now she stops again.  It is a man, h keeps coming, and now that he is close and recognizes him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe...? He smiles quizzically, hasn't quite heard her, stands rig in front of her, loose, smiling, disoriented and yet so appealing.  They are riveted on each other, uneasy and ye close. SUSAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're here... He is trying to get his bearings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- You bet. Something about him makes Susan slightly tentative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you go? Joe shrugs, scratches his head endearingly, uncertain of time and place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know -- y'know, I don't know -- it's all blurred up and hazy.  And would y'know what I mean if I said I don't think it's worth figuring out? Some realization is dawning on Susan, it renders her lightheaded. JOE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...But now I'm back. Susan regards Joe intently, searching his face for an answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I don't know what else to say. It's a helluva party --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...and you're the prettier thing here. Susan blinks, a long silence, she touches the sleeve of h jacket, now her hand traces the outline of his face, she regards him intently and the dilemma she has been struggl with the last moments fades away. Susan slowly realizes this is the Young Man. She is shake a sudden intake of breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you all right? His hand politely touches her elbow, courteously lending support.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The coffee shop -- The Young Man nods, pleased with her recognition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I asked you if I said something wrong and you said it was so right it scared you. Susan holds herself very still. YOUNG MAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And forgive me for saying this -- but then you said -- and it's been with me ever since --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What has --? He hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said you liked me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'didn't? A moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said I liked you so much. She falls silent now, overcome by the last moments' revelations.  The Young Man senses her discomfort which is on the edge of pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, everything's going great -- don't y'think? She doesn't answer for a moment. YOUNG MAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you feel that way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...We know so little about each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we've got time. She searches the Young Man's eyes, his face is open, completely vulnerable, waiting for her response.  A long silence, the words come out haltingly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish you could've known my father... Another moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me, too. Susan signs, the Young Man smiles gently, they are completely intent on each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...What do we do now? A long silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will come to us. Susan smiles, the fireworks finale goes off, the MUSIC co up from below, the night fills with light.  The Young Man searches Susan's face, now takes her hand -- and together they start back towards the party.
